intro: Cylindrosorus flavescens, commonly known as the golden thread moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, ribbon-like leaves that are typically bright yellow to green in color. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest floors or on rocks. Its structure consists of a prostrate stem with small, spirally arranged leaves. Cylindrosorus flavescens plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
